heading: Definitions - Unsecured PHI Definition
description: Organizations must understand and apply statutory definition of unsecured PHI in all compliance activities
key_controls: Documentation of definitions; Training materials; Policy statements

heading: Definitions - Breach Definition
description: Organizations must consistently apply statutory definition of breach requiring notification
key_controls: Breach definition in policies; Assessment procedures; Decision documentation

heading: Definitions - Compromise Presumption
description: Organizations must understand compromise presumption requirement that breaches compromise PHI unless proven otherwise
key_controls: Risk assessment process; Mitigation measures documentation

heading: Definitions - Business Associate Liability
description: Organizations must recognize that business associates are directly liable for HIPAA violations with same penalties as covered entities
key_controls: BAA language; Compliance monitoring procedures

heading: Breach Notification - Individual Notification
description: Covered entities must notify affected individuals of breaches of unsecured PHI without unreasonable delay no later than 60 calendar days
key_controls: Notification templates; Contact procedures; Delivery tracking

heading: Breach Notification - Media Notification
description: Covered entities must notify prominent media outlets if breach affects 500 or more residents in same state or jurisdiction within 60 calendar days
verification_method: Media notification records; Press release documentation
key_controls: Media contact lists; Press release templates; Delivery tracking

heading: Breach Notification - HHS Notification
description: Covered entities must notify HHS without unreasonable delay and no later than 60 calendar days for breaches affecting 500+ individuals or annually for smaller breaches
key_controls: HHS reporting form; Submission procedures; Tracking logs

heading: Breach Notification - Content Requirements
description: Breach notifications must include breach description dates affected individuals categories of PHI involved recommended individual steps entity investigation steps and contact information
key_controls: Notification templates; Content checklist; Quality review

heading: Breach Notification - Timeliness
description: Notification must occur without unreasonable delay but in all cases within 60 calendar days of discovery of breach
key_controls: Breach discovery log; Timeline tracking; Compliance monitoring

heading: Business Associate Breach Notification
description: Business associates must notify covered entities of any breach of unsecured PHI without unreasonable delay no later than 60 calendar days from discovery
verification_method: Breach notification letter; Delivery confirmation; Affected individual list
key_controls: BA notification procedures; Contact lists; Escalation procedures

heading: Business Associate Breach Detail Requirement
description: Business associates must provide detailed breach information including affected individuals PHI types mitigation steps and investigation results to enable covered entity notification
verification_method: Breach detail documentation; Information completeness review
key_controls: BA breach form; Information checklists; Documentation requirements

heading: Business Associate Agreement Requirement
description: Covered entities must execute written Business Associate Agreements with all entities that create receive maintain or transmit PHI on their behalf
key_controls: BAA template; Execution tracking; Version control

heading: Business Associate Agreement - Permitted Uses and Disclosures
description: Business Associate Agreements must specify exactly which uses and disclosures of PHI are permitted and for what purposes
key_controls: BAA permitted uses clauses; Scope definition; Change procedures

heading: Business Associate Agreement - Safeguard Requirements
description: Business Associate Agreements must require business associates to implement HIPAA Security Rule safeguards and Privacy Rule restrictions
key_controls: Safeguard requirements clauses; Compliance verification; Audit procedures

heading: Business Associate Agreement - Breach Notification
description: Business Associate Agreements must require business associates to notify covered entities of breaches within 60 calendar days
key_controls: Breach notification clauses; Contact procedures; Escalation paths

heading: Business Associate Agreement - Subcontractor Management
description: Business Associate Agreements must require management of subcontractors with same HIPAA and HITECH compliance obligations through written agreements
key_controls: Subcontractor management clauses; Flow-down templates; Monitoring procedures

heading: Penalty - Tier 1 Unknowing Violation
description: Penalties for unknowing violations range from $100 to $50000 per violation with annual cap of $1.5 million
key_controls: Corrective action plan; Compliance evidence; Risk mitigation

heading: Penalty - Tier 2 Reasonable Cause Violation
description: Penalties for reasonable cause violations range from $1000 to $50000 per violation with annual cap of $1.5 million
key_controls: Corrective action plan required; Compliance evidence

heading: Penalty - Tier 3 Willful Neglect (Corrected)
description: Penalties for willful neglect violations corrected within 30 days range from $10000 to $50000 per violation minimum $100000 annually with cap of $1.5 million
key_controls: Corrective action plan; Prompt correction evidence

heading: Penalty - Tier 4 Willful Neglect (Not Corrected)
description: Penalties for willful neglect violations not corrected within 30 days range from $20000 to $50000 per violation minimum and maximum $100000 to $1.5 million annually
key_controls: Mandatory corrective action; Compliance evidence required

heading: Penalty Mitigation - Recognized Security Practices
description: Penalties for Tier 3 violations may be reduced or waived if entity demonstrated implementation of recognized security practices for 12+ months preceding breach violation (Safe Harbor Amendment 2021)
verification_method: Documentation of recognized practices; Security audit records
key_controls: NIST CSF compliance; Encryption standards; Access controls; MFA; Audit logging

heading: OCR Authority - Investigation
description: HHS OCR has authority to investigate HIPAA and HITECH violations including responding to complaints and issuing subpoenas
key_controls: Complaint intake process; Investigation procedures; Documentation standards

heading: OCR Authority - Audits
description: HHS OCR has authority to conduct periodic compliance audits both desk audits and on-site audits of covered entities and business associates
key_controls: Audit procedures; Record retention; Audit cooperation

heading: OCR Authority - Penalty Assessment
description: HHS OCR has authority to assess civil monetary penalties for HIPAA and HITECH violations following investigation
key_controls: Penalty calculation; Payment procedures

heading: Business Associate - Safeguards Implementation
description: Business associates must implement HIPAA Privacy Rule and Security Rule safeguards as required by covered entity agreements
key_controls: Safeguard inventory; Implementation procedures; Audit trails

heading: Business Associate - Risk Assessment
description: Business associates must conduct regular risk assessments of PHI security vulnerabilities and implement remediation measures
key_controls: Risk assessment methodology; Vulnerability scanning; Remediation procedures

heading: Business Associate - Audit Logging
description: Business associates must maintain comprehensive audit logs of all PHI access and changes with retention period of at least 6 years
verification_method: Audit log records; Log retention verification
key_controls: Log retention policies; Access logging; Change tracking

heading: Business Associate - Breach Notification
description: Business associates must notify covered entities of breaches of unsecured PHI within 60 calendar days including affected individuals data involved and mitigation steps
key_controls: Breach notification procedures; Contact protocols; Escalation procedures

heading: Criminal Liability - Knowing Violation
description: Individuals who knowingly obtain or disclose PHI under false pretenses face criminal penalties up to $250000 fine and or 10 years imprisonment
key_controls: Legal compliance; Training; Access controls; Audit monitoring

heading: Criminal Liability - Commercial Advantage
description: Criminal liability applies to those who knowingly obtain or disclose PHI with intent to obtain commercial advantage or private gain
key_controls: Access control; Monitoring; Investigation procedures

heading: Accounting of Disclosures - 3-Year History
description: Covered entities and business associates must maintain detailed accounting of all PHI disclosures for 3-year period upon request
key_controls: Disclosure tracking system; Record retention; Audit logging

heading: Accounting of Disclosures - Content
description: Accounting must include date of disclosure recipient of PHI purpose of disclosure type of PHI disclosed and description of information
key_controls: Accounting templates; Content standards; Quality procedures

heading: Accounting of Disclosures - Timeliness
description: Covered entities must provide accounting of disclosures within 30 calendar days of individual request
verification_method: Disclosure records with timestamps; Response tracking
key_controls: Request intake; Timeline tracking; Compliance monitoring

heading: Restrictions on Use and Disclosure - Individual Request
description: Individuals have right to request restrictions on use and disclosure of PHI for any purpose including treatment payment and operations
key_controls: Request intake process; Documentation standards; Communication procedures

heading: Restrictions on Use and Disclosure - Implementation
description: Covered entities must implement restrictions requested by individuals and ensure restrictions are applied and maintained
key_controls: Restriction tracking system; Notification procedures; Compliance monitoring

heading: Corrective Action Plan - Development
description: Upon identification of violations covered entities and business associates must develop corrective action plans including root cause analysis remediation steps and implementation timelines
verification_method: CAP documentation; Root cause analysis; Implementation tracking
key_controls: CAP templates; Analysis procedures; Tracking procedures

heading: Corrective Action Plan - Implementation
description: Corrective action plans must be implemented with OCR monitoring and verification of compliance with specified timelines and success metrics
verification_method: Implementation records; Progress tracking; Completion verification
key_controls: Progress tracking; Monitoring procedures; Completion procedures

heading: Privacy and Security Rules - Risk Assessment
description: Covered entities and business associates must conduct regular risk assessments of ePHI storage transmission and systems identifying vulnerabilities and threats
key_controls: Risk assessment methodology; Vulnerability analysis; Remediation procedures

heading: Privacy and Security Rules - Encryption
description: Covered entities and business associates must encrypt electronic PHI at rest using AES-256 or equivalent and in transit using TLS 1.2 or higher
key_controls: Encryption standards documentation; Technical implementation; Audit procedures

heading: Privacy and Security Rules - Access Controls
description: Covered entities and business associates must implement strong access controls including unique user identification multi-factor authentication role-based access control and session timeouts
key_controls: User ID policy; MFA procedures; RBAC configuration; Timeout settings

heading: Privacy and Security Rules - Audit Logging
description: Covered entities and business associates must maintain comprehensive audit logs of all PHI access and system changes with retention of at least 6 years
verification_method: Audit log records; Log retention verification
key_controls: Log retention policy; Tamper detection; Access tracking

heading: Safe Harbor - Recognized Security Practices
description: Entities implementing recognized security practices from NIST Cybersecurity Framework or HHS 45 CFR 164.308(a)(7) guidance for 12+ months preceding breach may receive penalty reduction or waiver for Tier 3 violations
verification_method: Documentation of practices; Security audit records; Training records
key_controls: NIST CSF compliance; Implementation documentation; Audit trails

heading: State Attorney General - Civil Action Authority
description: State attorneys general have authority to pursue civil actions against entities for HIPAA and HITECH violations affecting state residents
key_controls: Legal compliance; Cooperation with state AG

heading: State Attorney General - Damages Recovery
description: State AGs can recover actual damages statutory damages up to $100 per violation court costs and attorney fees for HIPAA and HITECH violations
key_controls: Settlement procedures; Documentation

heading: Subcontractor - Direct Liability
description: Subcontractors and downstream vendors are directly liable under HIPAA for violations with same penalties as covered entities and business associates
key_controls: Written agreements; Compliance terms; Verification procedures

heading: Subcontractor - Written Agreement
description: Covered entities and business associates must execute written agreements with all subcontractors flowing down HIPAA and HITECH compliance obligations
key_controls: Agreement templates; Flow-down language; Tracking procedures

heading: Subcontractor - Breach Notification
description: Subcontractors must notify business associates and covered entities of breaches of unsecured PHI within 60 calendar days with affected individual details
key_controls: Breach notification procedures; Contact lists; Escalation paths

heading: Mitigating Factors - Good Faith Effort
description: OCR may reduce penalties if entity demonstrates good faith effort to comply with HIPAA and HITECH requirements
key_controls: Compliance documentation; Training records; Policy implementation

heading: Mitigating Factors - Prior Violations
description: OCR considers prior violation history when assessing penalties with fewer prior violations generally resulting in lower penalties
key_controls: Compliance history; Improvement documentation

heading: Mitigating Factors - Recognized Security Practices
description: OCR considers implementation of recognized security practices when assessing penalties which may result in reduction or waiver particularly for Tier 3 violations
key_controls: NIST CSF compliance; Security audit results; Implementation evidence

heading: Certified EHR - Functional Requirements
description: Certified EHR systems must include patient medical record management electronic prescribing drug interaction checking lab result viewing secure messaging audit logs and access controls
verification_method: Certification documentation; Feature testing; Compliance verification
key_controls: Functional testing; System documentation; Feature verification

heading: Certified EHR - Security Standards
description: Certified EHR systems must meet ONC security standards including encryption access control audit logging and incident response capabilities
verification_method: Security testing; Certification records; Audit trails
key_controls: Security testing procedures; Compliance verification; Audit documentation

heading: Certified EHR - Interoperability
description: Certified EHR systems must support health information exchange through APIs and standards-based data exchange
verification_method: Interoperability testing; Data exchange verification; API documentation
key_controls: Interoperability testing; API compliance; Data standards

heading: EHR Testing - ONC Certification Testing
description: Vendors must submit EHR systems to ONC-designated testing bodies for certification testing validating compliance with functional security and privacy requirements
verification_method: Certification testing results; ONC approval; Compliance documentation
key_controls: Testing procedures; Documentation; Compliance evidence

heading: EHR Testing - Certification Maintenance
description: EHR vendors must maintain certification of systems ensuring ongoing compliance with standards and undergoing recertification annually or when systems are updated
verification_method: Certification records; Update documentation; Recertification completion
key_controls: Recertification procedures; Version tracking; Compliance monitoring

heading: EHR Incentives - Eligible Provider
description: Eligible providers must adopt ONC-certified EHR systems and demonstrate meaningful use to qualify for Medicare and Medicaid incentive payments
verification_method: Attestation submission; Meaningful use documentation; Payment records
key_controls: Meaningful use tracking; Objective achievement; Attestation procedures

heading: EHR Incentives - Meaningful Use Objectives
description: Providers must achieve clinical administrative and interoperability objectives to demonstrate meaningful use of certified EHR systems
verification_method: Objective achievement records; Data validation; Attestation documentation
key_controls: Objective tracking; Data collection; Reporting procedures

heading: EHR Incentives - Incentive Payments
description: Providers demonstrating meaningful use receive Medicare and Medicaid payments on sliding scale with payments decreasing over time and transitioning to MIPS framework
verification_method: Payment records; Attestation submissions; Compliance documentation
key_controls: Payment tracking; Attestation procedures; Compliance documentation

heading: Grants - Eligibility
description: HHS and CMS provide grants to eligible healthcare organizations and providers for EHR adoption implementation and workforce training
verification_method: Grant application; Eligibility verification; Award documentation
key_controls: Application procedures; Eligibility documentation; Award tracking

heading: Grants - Permitted Uses
description: Grant funds must be used for EHR acquisition implementation workforce training and health IT infrastructure development
verification_method: Budget documentation; Expenditure records; Audit results
key_controls: Budget allocation; Expense tracking; Audit procedures

heading: Loans - Loan Programs
description: HHS and CMS establish loan programs with favorable interest rates for healthcare providers to finance EHR technology acquisition and implementation
verification_method: Loan agreement; Disbursement records; Repayment schedule
key_controls: Loan procedures; Repayment tracking

heading: Loans - Favorable Terms
description: EHR loans offer favorable interest rates terms and schedules to reduce capital barriers to technology adoption
verification_method: Loan documentation; Interest calculations; Repayment records
key_controls: Loan term documentation; Payment procedures

heading: Workforce Training - Program Development
description: HHS and CMS fund development of health IT workforce training programs including clinical informatics EHR system training and organizational change management
verification_method: Training program documentation; Curriculum; Enrollment records
key_controls: Curriculum development; Training delivery; Participant tracking

heading: Workforce Training - Certification Programs
description: Training programs must include certification options for health IT professionals to develop qualified workforce
verification_method: Certification program documentation; Completion records; Credential verification
key_controls: Certification procedures; Credential tracking; Quality assurance
